description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the MSHTML platform remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2023-35628), follow these steps:

1. Identify the correct KB updates applicable to your system:
   - For Windows 11: KB5033383, KB5033371, KB5033373, KB5033420, etc.
   - For Windows 10: KB5033371, KB5033372, KB5033375, etc.

2. Download the relevant update packages from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - [KB5033118](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033118)
   - [KB5033373](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033373)
   - [KB5033379](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033379)
   - [KB5033369](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033369)

3. Install the updates as per standard procedures for your operating system.

4. Restart your system to ensure all updates apply correctly.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses a critical remote code execution vulnerability that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code if a user opens a specially crafted document or visits an affected website.
- Ensure that your system builds are compatible with the respective KB articles mentioned.

**Preconditions**:
- Administrative privileges are required to install Windows updates.
- Backup critical data before installation to prevent data loss.
